Package osu.cse3241

Class CSE3241app

  • java.lang.Object
    • osu.cse3241.CSE3241app
  • public class CSE3241app
extends java.lang.Object

    CSE3241 Introduction to Database Systems - Sample Java application.

    Sample app to be used as guidance and a foundation for students of CSE3241 Introduction to Database Systems at The Ohio State University.

    !!! - Vulnerable to SQL injection - !!!

    Correct the code so that it is not vulnerable to a SQL injection attack. ("Parameter substitution" is the usual way to do this.)

    Class is written in Java SE 8 and in a procedural style. Implement a constructor if you build this app out in OOP style.

    Modify and extend this app as necessary for your project.

    Language Documentation:

    • Java SE 8
    • Java SE 8 API
    • Java JDBC API
    • SQLite
    • SQLite Java Tutorial

    • Field Detail

      • DATABASE

        private static java.lang.String DATABASE
        The database file name. Make sure the database file is in the root folder of the project if you only provide the name and extension. Otherwise, you will need to provide an absolute path from your C: drive or a relative path from the folder this class is in.

      • sqlStatement

        private static java.lang.String sqlStatement
        The query statement to be executed. Remember to include the semicolon at the end of the statement string. (Not all programming languages and/or packages require the semicolon (e.g., Python's SQLite3 library))

      • initializeDB

        public static java.sql.Connection initializeDB​(java.lang.String databaseFileName)
        Connects to the database if it exists, creates it if it does not, and returns the connection object.
        Parameters:
        databaseFileName - the database file name
        Returns:
        a connection object to the designated database

      • sqlQuery

        public static void sqlQuery​(java.sql.Connection conn,
                            java.lang.String sql)
        Queries the database and prints the results.
        Parameters:
        conn - a connection object
        sql - a SQL statement that returns rows
